incident_updates.body: We're currently working to resolve vault cluster issues.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
A deploy introduced a bug in statics routing causing them to 404 or otherwise error. A fix is being rolled out.
Deployments to AMS are functioning as expected.
Additional capacity has been provisioned and App deployments should succeed without issue.
We are currently working to alleviate capacity issues in the AMS region. Any deploys or new provisions are likely to fail right now but current workloads are unaffected.

incidents.name: Machine API Unavailable on some hosts/regions.

incident_updates.body: A permanent fix has been deployed in order to not prevent the API from starting due to a downstream service not being responsive.
We've resolved the issue on all affected hosts and are monitoring for additional errors.
We're currently working to restore the API on affected hosts/regions.

incidents.name: DNS Resolution for fly.dev occasionally failing

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have disabled the affected nameservers and are monitoring the results.
We are currently rolling back the bad configuration

incidents.name: Network connectivity issues in SCL region.

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved.
Network connectivity has been restored and we are monitoring the situation.
This outage has been caused by some emergency unscheduled maintenance in the datacenter. We currently expect service to be resumed in the next 30 minutes.
We are currently experiencing connectivity issues in the SCL region. We are working with our upstream providers to resolve this.
Capacity has been added to YUL

We are at capacity in YUL. This means your deployments might fail if the only region you have setup for your app is YUL. YYZ is also nearing capacity so we'd advise adding other nearby regions like IAD or EWR while we add more capacity in Montreal.

incidents.name: Delayed state causing proxying / deployment issues

incident_updates.body: This has been functioning properly for almost 24hrs. Now marking as Resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
An upgrade of our state propagation system is causing issues with proxying and deployments, a fix is being deployed

incidents.name: Flycast connectivity broken from certain (new) hosts

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are investigating an issue affecting app deployments with release commands, where a configured release command will run but the rest of the deployment won't continue.
To workaround the issue, remove/comment out the release_command in your app config.

incidents.name: Unable the schedule remote builder causing errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A temporary fix has been implemented which should unlock more capacity.
Generic errors are being thrown from our API when trying to provision a machine where no capacity is available. Remote builders are machines are so this is affecting deployment.
This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The proxy has returned to stable operation at this point. Our metrics indicate intermittent routing errors occurring between 18:10-18:45 UTC.
We have identified a routing issue in our edge proxy caused by a recent configuration update and are working on deploying a fix.

We observed a brief network interruption in a datacenter used by parts of our deployment process that caused deployments to be delayed and/or timeout for about 10 minutes between 22:20-22:30 UTC. The incident has been resolved.
Application hosts in SEA experienced a 17-minute network interruption from 08:49 - 09:06 UTC (00:49-01:06 PST local time), due to a temporary network issue at our datacenter provider.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Issues with multiple pacific ocean underwater cables providing connectivity to / from SIN with certain providers.

incidents.name: Old instances are mistakenly considered as candidates for routing

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Elevated instance connection timeout error rates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
There appears to be a lot more connection timeouts happening due to stale state. This was likely caused by the same change that caused the postgres clusters issues earlier.

incidents.name: Creating or listing checks for Postgres clusters return errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
A change in health checks timestamp precision caused problems with the machines API. A fix is being deployed.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

At 23:42 UTC on 2023-01-20 firewall rules were deployed that dropped traffic to fly-proxy. We quickly reverted the change, but the rollback encountered an issue. The rollback completed successfully around 23:59 UTC and operations resumed as usual.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently experiencing an outage with fly-proxy. Connections to Fly.io apps will receive connection refused errors. We're actively investigating.
Workaround identified. See forum post.

We tracked the source of this problem to an upgrade of Buildkit on Github Actions. See this community post for a workaround: https://community.fly.io/t/deploying-to-fly-via-github-action-failing/10171/19?u=jsierles
Some users are currently experiencing 'image not found' errors when using Github Actions to deploy.
This incident has been resolved.
All apps are back up and running on the affected host.

We're investigating a failure of a single application host in FRA. Most apps have been rerouted to other hosts in the region, but apps with mounted volumes on the affected host will remain unavailable as we work on recovery.
This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified at the impacted datacenter and a fix is being implemented.
There is an issue impacting network stability on a number of application hosts in the IAD region.

We investigated intermittent container-image issues and deployment failures in SIN, and tracked down the issue to a congested public Internet route from SIN to AWS us-east-1 impacting container image pull performance. Our monitoring shows this network congestion occurring daily from Jan 10-12, roughly between 02:00-18:00 UTC.

We deployed a change to our container registry to route around this network congestion, so the deployment issues should now be resolved moving forward.
This incident has been resolved.
We've added more resources to IAD and deployments are no longer being delayed.
We're investigating delayed deployments in the IAD (Ashburn, Virginia US) region. This region is at full capacity and we're working on adding more resources.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We're investigating slow response times across our platform APIs.

incidents.name: Routing issues for newly allocated IPv6 addresses

incident_updates.body: IPv6 addresses are working properly and certificate issuance is back to normal.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are investigating routing issues for new apps. These are preventing access over IPv6 and interfering with certificate generation.

incidents.name: Deployments may take 10-15min in fra region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We're experiencing high utilization in the fra (Frankfurt) region. Deployments and scale up events in the region may take 10-15min, or more in some cases, to complete. This does not impact running apps; they will continue to work as expected.

flyctl may detach during deployments to instances in Frankfurt. The deployments will continue to completion. Use `fly status` or the "Monitoring" tab in the dashboard to track progress.

Deployments to the fra region require a paid plan (Launch, Scale, Enterprise, or a legacy paid plan). Existing apps and allocs running in fra are not affected. The limitation affects new apps, volumes, and changes to scale. This is a temporary restriction.

incidents.name: Apps with a shared IPv4 and a dedicated IPv6 are inaccessibly over IPv6

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.
Maintenance is complete.

We are increasing database capacity. This requires a failover between cluster nodes. There may be a small outage while the failover happens that will result in some API calls failing. This will not impact running apps.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating issues in deploying applications
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
DNSimple has identified the issue and things seem to be improving.

You can workaround this DNS issue if you own your own domain. Run `fly ips list` to see the IPs assigned to your app, then create an A record pointing to the IPv4 address, and an AAAA record pointed to the IPv6 address. Then `fly certs add <yourhostname>`.
Name resolution is failing for fly.dev (and other DNSimple hosted domains).
This incident has been resolved.
The service has recovered and application deployments are working normally again. We are continuing to actively monitor the service cluster and investigate the root cause to prevent further issues.
We're experiencing further issues with our Nomad cluster affecting application deployments.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been applied to the cluster, and application deployments appear to be working normally again.
We are investigating an issue with our Nomad cluster affecting application deployments.

incidents.name: Delayed private DNS entries, machines list and proxy upstreams

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Our state replicate system is lagging behind. Were working on a fix, expect things to improve in the next few days.
All remaining machines have been migrated.
All Postgres apps and pg_data volumes recreated from latest available snapshot were moved last night. Only a few remaining machines are left to migrate.

Applications without volumes have all been restarted on other hosts in the region.  Most volumes have been restored from their most recent daily snapshot and are migrated to another host. Recently-written data will be unavailable for volumes not in a multi-node cluster.
We are working to replace a failed disk.
We are troubleshooting a failed host in ORD.
This incident has been resolved.
A proxy change was reverted and we're now monitoring the situation.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Intermittent deployment failures in the IAD region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating high load on a server in IAD. Deployments may intermittently fail during this time.
This incident has been resolved.

Our datacenter provider confirmed an undersea cable cut is affecting long-distance networking connectivity in JNB. Although local networking within the region was not impacted, we observed packet loss to other remote regions between 14:20 - 19:50 UTC. The situation appears to have stabilized for now and we will continue to monitor.
We are investigating a loss of service in JNB
This incident has been resolved.

The metrics cluster is now starting to recover and ingest new data.
The root cause seems to have been severely degraded network connections at the datacenter hosting the metrics cluster, lasting about 5 hours from ~14:00 - 19:00 UTC.
Our multi-tenant metrics cluster is currently not ingesting new data
This issue has been resolved
The upstream network issues have been resolved and we are monitoring the situation
We are investigating a loss of service in MAA

These servers are used for postgres election and when any of them go down, some postgres clusters may go down.

There was an outage of our second FRA Consul Server cluster between 8:46AM and 9:34AM UTC.

We're still investigating the cause.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating a load issue causing slow deployment operations on a single server in the ORD region. Some deployments in ORD may take longer than expected to complete until this is resolved.
This has been resolved.  App logs are working as expected.
We slowly bringing app logs back online.
We are currently investigating this issue
The maintenance has been completed.
Following yesterdays outage engineers are performing further emergency network maintenance.
This issue has been resolved
We are currently investigating a network outage in the JNB region.

incidents.name: Elasticsearch errors causing issues for customer logs during deployments

incident_updates.body: Our Elasticsearch cluster was fixed. This incident is resolved.
We've identified the issue and implemented a fix.
We're looking into a partial outage in our Elasticsearch cluster, causing 422 errors during deployments with release commands defined, or when fetching logs.
This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Application Hosting - EWR - Secaucus, New Jersey (US)

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Application Hosting - EWR - Secaucus, New Jersey (US)

incident_updates.body: We are troubleshooting a failed host in EWR. Apps with a single volume that were provisioned to this host will be unavailable until it's recovered. Apps, and Postgres instances, with multiple volumes should remain accessible for the duration, but with reduced redundancy.

affected_components.name: Application Hosting - EWR - Secaucus, New Jersey (US)

incidents.name: Consul/Nomad outage interfering with app instance scheduling

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have cleaned up most lingering issues from the Consul/Nomad outage and are monitoring to ensure that peoples' apps recover properly.
We are still working on this issue. Deploys, restarts, and rescheduling of apps are all currently affected by this.
We are having continued issues with our consul and nomad clusters. We are working on restoring them.
We've repaired our Nomad and Consul clusters and are working through a backlog of queued operations. Deployments and restarts will continue to be delayed ~5-30m until the queue is empty.
Deployment monitoring is erroring in most cases. Deployments themselves are working through a queue. It's currently taking upwards of 30 minutes for deploys to take effect.
We are currently investigating an issue with consul and nomad, which is causing issues with deployment monitoring. Deployments are still happening.

incidents.name: New app deployments are broken due to exhausted IPv4

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Intermittent image pull failures from registry.fly.io

incident_updates.body: The issue was resolved as of 22:30 UTC on 2022-10-25.
We have identified the root cause and rolled out a fix. We're continuing to monitor.
We're seeing an increased number of EOF errors or timeouts when pulling images from registry.fly.io during deploys.
